Sample from Cuadras-Auge distribution

Source: R/sample.R
rmo_esm_cuadras_auge.Rd

Draws n independent samples from a d variate Cuadras-Augé distribution with parameters alpha and beta.

rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(n, d, alpha, beta)

Arguments

n

number of samples
d

dimension
alpha

rate of individual shocks
beta

rate of global shock

Value

rmo_esm_cuadras_auge implements an optimized version of the exogenous shock model representation for the Cuadras-Augé family and returns an \(n \times d\) array matrix with rows corresponding to the independent samples of size \(d\).

Details

  • alpha is the shock intensity of shocks that affect only single components.

  • beta is the shock intensity of the global shock that affects all components.

See also

rmo_esm

Other samplers: rexmo_markovian(), rmo_esm(), rmo_lfm_cpp()

Examples

rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(10L, 2L, 0.5, 0.2)

#>             [,1]       [,2]
#>  [1,] 1.84448426 0.16123876
#>  [2,] 0.28233880 1.44215771
#>  [3,] 1.14005604 1.14005604
#>  [4,] 0.03690963 0.10519624
#>  [5,] 3.69063543 4.37326292
#>  [6,] 0.91271989 0.08064858
#>  [7,] 0.97207295 0.09712054
#>  [8,] 0.49912475 3.51674739
#>  [9,] 1.04423762 0.25754291
#> [10,] 0.55624395 2.41798025
rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(10L, 2L, 0, 1)      ## comonotone

#>            [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] 1.1312699 1.1312699
#>  [2,] 0.6884628 0.6884628
#>  [3,] 0.8172443 0.8172443
#>  [4,] 0.4268239 0.4268239
#>  [5,] 4.0584419 4.0584419
#>  [6,] 0.2529130 0.2529130
#>  [7,] 0.6558426 0.6558426
#>  [8,] 0.2861381 0.2861381
#>  [9,] 0.4169685 0.4169685
#> [10,] 0.1200703 0.1200703
rmo_esm_cuadras_auge(10L, 2L, 1, 0)      ## independence

#>             [,1]       [,2]
#>  [1,] 2.48577980 0.24300920
#>  [2,] 4.26711665 0.97890153
#>  [3,] 0.10172479 1.63717892
#>  [4,] 3.14863010 0.36928823
#>  [5,] 0.02880499 0.04497353
#>  [6,] 0.52422183 2.33358958
#>  [7,] 1.45435566 0.61939240
#>  [8,] 0.11876648 0.46745937
#>  [9,] 1.09192908 0.25013858
#> [10,] 1.53476817 0.36159723
